attributes.comment:
A National Directory of Healthcare Providers and Services can facilitate a multitude of services including transportation arrangement for a patient/beneficiary/consumer. As necessary,CMS should seek congressional changes allowing the creation of non-emergency transportation services. Medical,Psychiatric or Psychological conditions can prohibit and or cause difficulties with self transportation. It's recommended CMS seek congressional changes if necessary to establish statewide partnerships that allows part B to reimburse private cab or transportation companies transporting medicare beneficiaries to and from medicare approved appointments. It's further recommended CMS seek congressional changes if necessary to consider an individualized assessment of a beneficiary's medical/psychiatric or psychological needs and expand non-emergency transportation to non-medical locations. As an example,transporting a person with mental health challenges to a pharmacy or grocery store.

Thank you for this opportunity to comment.

--
This submission may or may not contain error and or flaw.

Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and or The Americans with Disabilities Act

shall apply.

attributes.title: Comment on CMS-2022-0163-0001
